citeinfo.title: Predicted distribution of groundfish and benthic invertebrate community types on the Scotian Shelf and in the Bay of Fundy from DFO source data, UTM 20 (2007-2016) [Maritimes_PredClust_map]

descript.abstract: This raster layer shows the predicted distribution of 6 unique ecological groupings of groundfish and benthic invertebrates on the Scotian Shelf and in the Bay of Fundy. The groupings were delineated by hierachical clustering of presence/absence data from DFO annual multispecies trawl surveys from 2007-2017 conducted in spring Feb-Apr (mainly Mar) and summer Jun-Aug (mainly Jul). Their distribution is predicted from a random forest classification model indicating the probabilities that each grouping occurs at a given location based on the value of 11 abiotic predictor variables at that location. Predictions are provided at a resolution of 4 km and bounded by the limits of the RV survey strata with a 5 km land buffer also applied.
descript.purpose: This layer was developed in support of Marine Protected Area network planning; chiefly to facilitate incorporating representative community types in the network plan.
descript.supplinf:
Abiotic predictors used in random forest classification in order of variable importance:
Depth Average minimum annual bottom temperature Average maximum annual bottom temperature Average maximum annual bottom salinity Dissolved oxygen Slope Bathymetric Position Index (10 km radius) Average maximum spring/summer PP Average mean annual bottom stress Bathymetric Position Index (0.5 km radius) Aspect
